CVE-2011-0718.title: Red Hat Network Satellite weak security
CVE-2011-0718.body: Red Hat Network Satellite could provide weaker than expected security, caused by an error when handling failed log in attempts. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to guess passwords via brute force techniques.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2011-0719.title: Samba FD_SET denial of service
CVE-2011-0719.body: Samba is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a memory corruption error related to missing range checks on file descriptors being used in the "FD_SET" macro. By performing a select on a bad file descriptor set, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Samba (3.5.7 or later), available from the Samba Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2011-0721.title: shadow chfn and chsh CRLF injection
CVE-2011-0721.body: shadow is vulnerable to CRLF injection, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by chfn and chsh. By persuading a victim to click on a specially-crafted URL link containing CRLF character sequences, a local attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the GECOS field to add new users or groups to /etc/passwd and conduct cross-site scripting, cache poisoning or session hijacking.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2011-0725.title: Aptdaemon org.debian.apt.UpdateCachePartially information disclosure
CVE-2011-0725.body: Aptdaemon could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an absolute path traversal in the org.debian.apt.UpdateCachePartially method. By sending a direct request using the full pathname, a local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to read arbitrary files on the system.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2011-0728.title: loggerhead filename cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-0728.body: loggerhead is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input related to the filename by templatefunctions.py. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of loggerhead (1.18.1 or later), available from the loggerhead Web page. See References.

CVE-2011-0738.title: MyProxy SSL spoofing
CVE-2011-0738.body: MyProxy could allow a remote attacker to conduct spoofing attacks, caused by the improper validation of the SSL server certificate validation by the myproxy-logon application. By persuading a victim to visit a Web site containing a specially-crafted certificate, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using man-in-the-middle techniques to cause the victim to accept spoofed certificates. Note: This vulnerability also affects Globus Toolkit.Upgrade to the latest version of MyProxy (5.3 or later), available from the Alexander Dietrich Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0739.title: Mail gem for Ruby deliver() command execution
CVE-2011-0739.body: The Mail gem for Ruby could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by the improper validation of input by the deliver() function. If the gem uses sendmail for mail delivery, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary shell commands on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Mail gem for Ruby (2.2.15 or later), available from the Ruby's Mail Discussion Group Web page. See References.

CVE-2011-0740.title: RSS Feed Reader plugin for WordPress magpie_slashbox.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-0740.body: The RSS Feed Reader plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the magpie_slashbox.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the rss_url parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2011-0741.title: MODx Evolution multiple cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-0741.body: MODx Evolution is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by multiple scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unknown parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of MODx Evolution (1.0.5 or later), available from the MODx Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0742.title: Novell ZENworks Handheld Management (ZHM) ZfHIPCnd.exe buffer overflow
CVE-2011-0742.body: Novell ZENworks Handheld Management (ZHM) is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the ZfHIPCnd.exe Access Point process. By sending a specially-crafted request to TCP port 2400, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with SYSTEM privileges or cause the application to crash.Refer to Novell Document ID: 7007663 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2011-0745.title: SugarCRM list information disclosure
CVE-2011-0745.body: SugarCRM could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by insecure permissions being set on the list privilege. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and view a list of customer contacts.Upgrade to the latest version of SugarCRM (6.1.3 or later), available from the SugarCRM Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0748.title: PHPList admin page cross-site request forgery
CVE-2011-0748.body: PHPList is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the admin page. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to perform unauthorized actions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2011-0751.title: nostromo nhttpd HTTP command execution
CVE-2011-0751.body: nostromo nhttpd could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted HTTP request containing URL-encoded "dot dot" sequences (..%2F ..%2F) to traverse directories or inject and execute arbitrary commands on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of nostromo nhttpd (1.9.4 or later), available from the NAZGUL Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0752.title: PHP extract function security bypass
CVE-2011-0752.body: PHP could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the failure to prevent the use of the EXTR_OVERWRITE parameter to overwrite the GLOBALS superglobal array and the this variable by the extract function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and gain unauthorized access to the application.Upgrade to the latest version of PHP (5.2.15 or later), available from The PHP Group Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0757.title: IBM DB2 DBADM privilege escalation
CVE-2011-0757.body: IBM DB2 could allow a remote attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by an error while revoking DBADM privileges. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute non-DDL statements and gain elevated privileges on the system.Apply IBM APAR IC66811, IC66814 or IC66815, available from IBM Support and Downloads. See References.

CVE-2011-0759.title: WP-reCAPTCHA plugin for WordPress multiple cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-0759.body: The WP-reCAPTCHA plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by plugin's configuration page. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using various parameters to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of WP-reCAPTCHA 3.0, available from the WP-reCAPTCHA Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0759.title: WP-reCAPTCHA plugin for WordPress cross-site request forgery
CVE-2011-0759.body: The WP-reCAPTCHA plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to perform unauthorized actions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Upgrade to the latest version of WP-reCAPTCHA 3.0, available from the WP-reCAPTCHA Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0760.title: Related Posts plugin for WordPress configuration cross-site request forgery
CVE-2011-0760.body: Related Posts plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the configuration page. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to inject configuration values. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2011-0760.title: Related Posts plugin for WordPress configuration page cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-0760.body: Related Posts plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the configuration page. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the wp_relatedposts_ title, wp_relatedposts_num or wp_relatedposts_type fields to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2011-0764.title: Xpdf t1lib code execution
CVE-2011-0764.body: Xpdf could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by the improper parsing of Type 1 fonts by the t1lib library. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted PDF file with an application that uses the vulnerable library, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the affected application to crash.For xpdf: Upgrade to the latest version of xpdf (3.02pl6 or later), available from the Xpdf Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0767.title: Imperva SecureSphere Web Application Firewall Web server cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-0767.body: Imperva SecureSphere Web Application Firewall is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Web server. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to SWRX-2011-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2011-0770.title: HP Arcsight Connector Appliance cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-0770.body: HP Arcsight Connector Appliance is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Windows Event Log SmartConnector when importing a report. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the Microsoft OS Version field to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Arcsight Connector Appliance (6.1 or later), available from the HP Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0771.title: Janrain Engage module for Drupal file upload
CVE-2011-0771.body: The Janrain Engage module for Drupal could allow a remote attacker to upload arbitrary files, caused by the improper validation of file extensions using profile image upload functionality. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to upload a malicious PHP script, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary PHP code on the vulnerable system.Refer to SA-CONTRIB-2011-003 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2011-0771.title: The Janrain Engage module for Drupal unspecified cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-0771.body: The Janrain Engage module for Drupal is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unspecified parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to SA-CONTRIB-2011-003 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2011-0772.title: PivotX blogroll.php and timwrapper.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-0772.body: PivotX is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the blogroll.php and timwrapper.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the color or src parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of PivotX, (2.2.2 or later), available from the PivotX. See References.

CVE-2011-0773.title: PivotX image.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-0773.body: PivotX is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the image.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the image parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of PivotX , (2.2.2 or later), available from the PivotX. See References.

CVE-2011-0886.title: Multiple SMCD3G-CCR gateways interface cross-site request forgery
CVE-2011-0886.body: Multiple SMCD3G-CCR gateways are vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the management interface. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to modify device configuration and enable remote administration. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Refer to SMCD3G-CCR for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2011-0887.title: Multiple SMCD3G-CCR gateways weak security
CVE-2011-0887.body: Multiple SMCD3G-CCR gateways could provide weaker than expected, caused by the use of predictable values to validate the management portal session. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using brute force techniques to gain unauthorized access to the device.Refer to SMCD3G-CCR for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2011-0900.title: Terminal Server Client hostname buffer overflow
CVE-2011-0900.body: Terminal Server Client (tsclient) is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the tsc_launch_remote() function when processing the hostname parameter. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted RDP file containing an overly long string, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2011-0901.title: Terminal Server Client domain buffer overflow
CVE-2011-0901.body: Terminal Server Client (tsclient) is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the tsc_launch_remote() function when processing the domain parameter. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted RDP file containing an overly long string, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2011-0901.title: Terminal Server Client password buffer overflow
CVE-2011-0901.body: Terminal Server Client (tsclient) is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the tsc_launch_remote() function when processing the password parameter. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted RDP file containing an overly long string, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2011-0903.title: AWCM awcm_theme file include
CVE-2011-0903.body: AWCM could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to header.php script using the awcm_theme cookie parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2011-0904.title: Vino input denial of service
CVE-2011-0904.body: Vino is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper validation of input. By sending specially-crafted input, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2011-0905.title: Vino framebuffer denial of service
CVE-2011-0905.body: Vino is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the rfbSendFramebufferUpdate() function when handling specific client framebuffer requests. By sending a specially-crafted framebuffer request packet, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2011-0925.title: Cisco Secure Desktop ActiveX control code execution
CVE-2011-0925.body: The Cisco Secure Desktop (CSD) ActiveX control (CSDWebInstallerCtrl) could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system when handling a Cisco-signed executable file named "inst.exe". By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page that passes an overly long string argument, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the user or cause the victim's browser to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2011-0926.title: Cisco Secure Desktop ActiveX control code execution
CVE-2011-0926.body: The Cisco Secure Desktop (CSD) ActiveX control (CSDWebInstallerCtrl) could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by the improper verification of digital signature of an executable file that is downloaded and executed. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page that passes an overly long string argument, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the user or cause the victim's browser to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2011-0959.title: Cisco Unified Operations Manager multiple cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-0959.body: Cisco Unified Operations Manager is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by multiple scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using various parameters in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Cisco Unified Operations Manager (8.6 or later), available from the Cisco Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0960.title: Cisco Unified Operations Manager PRTestCreation.do SQL injection
CVE-2011-0960.body: Cisco Unified Operations Manager is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the PRTestCreation.do and TelePresenceReportAction.do scripts using the CCMs or ccm parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Cisco Unified Operations Manager (8.6 or later), available from the Cisco Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0961.title: Cisco Unified Operations Manager Common Services Framework Help Servlet cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-0961.body: Cisco Unified Operations Manager is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Common Services Framework Help Servlet. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unspecified parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Cisco Unified Operations Manager (8.6 or later), available from the Cisco Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0962.title: Cisco Unified Operations Manager Common Services Device Center cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-0962.body: Cisco Unified Operations Manager is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Common Services Device Center. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using various parameters in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Cisco Unified Operations Manager (8.6 or later), available from the Cisco Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0966.title: Cisco Unified Operations Manager auditLog.do directory traversal
CVE-2011-0966.body: Cisco Unified Operations Manager could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the auditLog.do script containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the file parameter to view arbitrary files on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Cisco Unified Operations Manager (8.6 or later), available from the Cisco Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0975.title: Multiple BMC products BMC Patrol Agent buffer overflow
CVE-2011-0975.body: Multiple BMC products are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the BMC Patrol Agent when processing BGS_MULTIPLE_READS commands. By sending a specially-crafted request to TCP port 6768, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (QM001683974), available from the BMC Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0986.title: phpMyAdmin README path disclosure
CVE-2011-0986.body: phpMyAdmin could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the README, ChangeLog and LICENSE files using an invalid parameter to cause an error message to be returned containing the full installation path. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.Refer to PMASA-2011-1 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2011-0987.title: phpMyAdmin bookmark security bypass
CVE-2011-0987.body: phpMyAdmin could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error when handling bookmarks. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the execution of another user's SQL query.Refer to PMASA-2011-2 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2011-0988.body: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server and Desktop could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by the use of a world writeable directory created and used by the OES pure-ftpd Netware extensions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to overwrite system files.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2011-0989.title: Momo Moonlight RuntimeHelpers.InitializeArray security bypass
CVE-2011-0989.body: Momo Moonlight could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by missing validations on RuntimeHelpers.InitializeArray. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability via untrusted code to crash plugins or corrupt Moonlight's security manager internal state.Upgrade to the latest version of Momo Moonlight (2.4.1, 3.99.3 or later), available from the Momo Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0991.title: Momo Moonlight DynamicMethod code execution
CVE-2011-0991.body: Momo Moonlight could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a use-after-free error in DynamicMethod instances. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Momo Moonlight (2.4.1, 3.99.3 or later), available from the Momo Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0992.title: Momo Moonlight MonoThread information disclosure
CVE-2011-0992.body: Momo Moonlight could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper cleanup when freeing unmanaged MonoThread instances. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain information or cause the plugin to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Momo Moonlight (2.4.1, 3.99.3 or later), available from the Momo Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0993.title: SUSE Lifecycle Management Server (SLMS) information disclosure
CVE-2011-0993.body: SUSE Lifecycle Management Server (SLMS) could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the use of world readable postgres credentials. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.Upgrade to the latest version of Lifecycle Management Server (1.1 or later), available from the SUSE Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-0994.title: Novell File Reporter Agent NFRAgent.exe buffer overflow
CVE-2011-0994.body: Novell File Reporter Agent is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the NFRAgent.exe binary. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using specially-crafted XML tags to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code with SYSTEM privileges or cause the application to crash.Refer to Novell Document ID: 5090790 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2011-0995.title: sqlite3-ruby package file overwrite
CVE-2011-0995.body: The sqlite3-ruby package could allow a local attacker to overwrite arbitrary files on the system, caused by insecure file permissions being set. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to overwrite or corrupt arbitrary files on the system.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2011-0997.title: ISC DHCP dhclient command execution
CVE-2011-0997.body: ISC DHCP could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by the failure to strip specific shell meta-characters when processing DHCP server responses by the dhclient. By sending a specially-crafted hostname response, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary shell commands on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of ISC DHCP (3.1-ESV-R1 and 4.1-ESV-R2 or 4.2.1-P1 or later), available from the Internet Systems Consortium Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2011-1000.title: Telepathy Gabble google:jingleinfo security bypass
CVE-2011-1000.body: Telepathy Gabble could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error in the Jabber/XMMP connection manager when processing google:jingleinfo updates. An attacker that is the target's contact could exploit this vulnerability to intercept audio and video calls.Upgrade to the latest version of Gabble (0.11.7 or later), available from the Telepathy Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-1002.title: Avahi UDP packet denial of service
CVE-2011-1002.body: Avahi is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a NULL pointer dereference error within the avahi-core/socket.c. By sending a specially-crafted UDP packet to UDP port 5353, a remote attacker could exploit the vulnerability to cause the application to consume all available CPU resources.Upgrade to the latest version of Avahi (0.6.26 or later), available from the Avahi Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-1002.title: Avahi UDP denial of service
CVE-2011-1002.body: Avahi is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a NULL pointer dereference error within the avahi-core/socket.c. By sending a specially-crafted UDP packet to UDP port 5353, a remote attacker could exploit the vulnerability to cause the application to enter into an infinite loop.Upgrade to the latest version of Avahi (0.6.26 or later), available from the Avahi Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-1003.title: ClamAV vba_read_project_strings() denial of service
CVE-2011-1003.body: ClamAV is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a double-free error within the vba_read_project_strings() function. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of ClamAV (0.97 or later), available from the Clam AntiVirus. See References.

CVE-2011-1008.title: Best Practical Solutions RT Scrips_Overlay.pm information disclosure
CVE-2011-1008.body: Best Practical Solutions RT (Request Tracker) could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the failure to restrict access to a TicketObj in a Scrip after a CurrentUser change by Scrips_Overlay.pm. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using unknown attack vectors to obtain sensitive information.Upgrade to the latest version of Request Tracker (3.8.9), available from the Best Practical Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-1011.title: policycoreutils seunshare symlink
CVE-2011-1011.body: policycoreutils could allow a local attacker to launch a symlink attack. The seunshare utility creates invalid temporary files insecurely. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a symbolic link from a temporary file to various files on the system, which could allow the attacker to overwrite arbitrary files on the system with elevated privileges.Upgrade to the latest version of SELinux policycoreutils 2.0.85, available from the SELinux policycoreutils Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-1013.title: Linux Kernel DRM IOCTL privilege escalation
CVE-2011-1013.body: Linux Kernel could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by the improper validation of input by the DRM IOCTL. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using specially-crafted IOCTLs to gain elevated privileges on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Linux Kernel (2.6.38-rc7 or later), available from the The Linux Kernel Archives Web site. See References.

CVE-2011-1016.title: linux kernel ATI Radeon security bypass
CVE-2011-1016.body: Linux Kernel could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the improper validation of input passed to the AARESOLVE_OFFSET registers by ATI Radeon R300. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to write arbitrary data to VRAM and GTT memory.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the Linux Kernel GIT Repository. See References.

CVE-2011-1020.title: Linux Kernel proc/security bypass
CVE-2011-1020.body: Linux Kernel could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the improper handling of opened files within the "/proc/<pid>/" directory. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to modify process settings and obtain specific memory.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2011-1026.title: Apache Archiva multiple cross-site request forgery

CVE-2011-1344.body: Apple Safari could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by the improper handling of WBR tags on a Web page by WebKit. CVE-2011-1355.title: WebSphere Application Server logoutExitPage parameter security bypass
CVE-2011-1355.body: WebSphere Application Server could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper validation by the logoutExitPage parameter. CVE-2011-1356.title: WebSphere Application Server Administration Console information disclosure
CVE-2011-1356.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper handling of Administration Console requests. By sending a specially-crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to view the stack trace.For WebSphere Application Server 6.1: Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.1.0.39 or later) or APAR PM36620. See References. For WebSphere Application Server 7.0: Apply the latest Fix Pack (7.0.0.19 or later) or APAR PM36620. See References.

CVE-2011-1357.title: IBM WebSphere Service Registry and Repository agentDetect.jsp cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-1357.body: WebSphere Service Registry and Repository is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the agentDetect.jsp script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the USER-AGENT parameter to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.For WebSphere Service Registry and Repository 6.3: Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.3.0.5 or later) or APAR IV01657. See References. For WebSphere Service Registry and Repository 7.0: Apply the latest Fix Pack (7.0.0.5 or later) or APAR IV01657. See References. For WebSphere Service Registry and Repository 7.5: Apply the latest Fix Pack (7.5.0.1 or later) or APAR IV01657. See References.

CVE-2011-1359.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server administration console directory traversal
CVE-2011-1359.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the administration console containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) to view arbitrary files on the system.For WebSphere Application Server 6.1: Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.1.0.41 or later) or APAR PM45322. See References. For WebSphere Application Server 7.0: Apply the latest Fix Pack (7.0.0.19 or later) or APAR PM45322. See References. For WebSphere Application Server 8.0: Apply the latest Fix Pack (8.0.0.1 or later) or APAR PM45322. See References.

CVE-2011-1360.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server HTTP Server documentation cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-1360.body: The IBM WebSphere Application Server HTTP Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by a documentation page located in the manual/ibm sub-directories. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.For WebSphere Application Server 5.1: Apply IBM APAR PM41293. See References.

CVE-2011-1362.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Installation Verification Tool servlet (IVT) cross-site scripting
CVE-2011-1362.body: WebSphere Application Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Installation Verification Tool servlet (IVT).
